ANU.name: Bert Fraussen
ANU.colleges: College of Arts and Social Sciences
interest: Interest Group Politics; Policy Advisory Systems; Organization Design and Development; European Union Politics
ANU.biography: I am a Visiting Research Fellow at the Antwerp Centre for Institutions and Multilevel Politics (https://www.uantwerpen.be/en/rg/acim/) and a member of the ECPR Standing Group on Interest Groups (http://www.ecpr-sgig.eu/), the Comparative Interest Group Populations Network (http://www.interest-groups.org/) and the Belgian Political Science Association. Furthermore, I hold degrees in Global Management (Antwerp Management School), Public Administration (KU Leuven) and Political Science (University of Antwerp). From 2006 until 2008, I also worked part-time as an assistant to a Member of the European Parliament, as well as at Europe Direct.
project: “Public Policy and the Transformation of Political Advocacy” (in collaboration with Professor Darren R. Halpin). For more information, visit our project website: http://interestgroupsaustralia.com/.
